## Functions

### isIdempotentRMW() {#aa285536df532aacbbbac1e2ce635e782}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool anonymous&#95;namespace&#123;InstCombineAtomicRMW.cpp&#125;::isIdempotentRMW (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/atomicrmwinst">AtomicRMWInst</a> &amp; RMWI)</>}>
Return true if and only if the given instruction does not modify the memory location referenced.

Note that an idemptent atomicrmw may still have ordering effects on nearby instructions, or be volatile. TODO: Common w/ the version in <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/atomicexpandpass">AtomicExpandPass</a>, and change the term used. Idemptotent is confusing in this context.

Return true if the given instruction always produces a value in memory equivalent to its value operand.
